availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Horace Fletcher (Jessamine County, Kentucky, physician, justice of the peace, and assistant surgeon)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, physician, justice of the peace, and assistant surgeon. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Fletcher. Father of Cordelia Fletcher. Physician in Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Physician in Jessamine County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Jessamine County in 1860. Served in the Twelfth Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A) as assistant surgeon from November 17, 1862, to December 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 68A-68B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 121.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 921.
KYR-0001-017-0117.
